unnormalised: ## Discovering the Ancient Wisdom: My Journey with Ayurveda
normalised: ## Discovering the Ancient Wisdom: My Journey with Ayurveda

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Hope you're all doing well. Recently, I’ve been diving deep into Ayurveda, and honestly, it’s been a game-changer. For those who don't know, Ayurveda is an ancient Indian system of medicine that focuses on holistic healing – mind, body, and spirit.
normalised: Hey everyone! Hope you're all doing well. Recently, I’ve been diving deep into Ayurveda, and honestly, it’s been a game-changer. For those who don't know, Ayurveda is an ancient Indian system of medicine that focuses on holistic healing – mind, body, and spirit.

unnormalised: I started feeling a bit run down, you know? Just the usual stress of work, managing a household, and the occasional Delhi traffic jam got me. My skin was dull, I wasn't sleeping well, and my digestion was off. My friend, Priya, suggested I look into Ayurvedic treatments.
normalised: I started feeling a bit run down, you know? Just the usual stress of work, managing a household, and the occasional Delhi traffic jam got me. My skin was dull, I wasn't sleeping well, and my digestion was off. My friend, Priya, suggested I look into Ayurvedic treatments.

unnormalised: At first, I was a little skeptical. I mean, I’m used to popping a pill for every ailment. But Priya insisted I visit Dr. Sharma at his clinic in Karol Bagh. He did a thorough consultation, checking my “doshas” (vata, pitta, and kapha) and explaining how imbalances can lead to various health issues.
normalised: At first, I was a little skeptical. I mean, I’m used to popping a pill for every ailment. But Priya insisted I visit Doctor Sharma at his clinic in Karol Bagh. He did a thorough consultation, checking my “doshas” (vata, pitta, and kapha) and explaining how imbalances can lead to various health issues.

unnormalised: He recommended a personalized treatment plan that included Abhyanga (warm oil massage), Shirodhara (pouring oil on the forehead – so relaxing!), and some herbal supplements. Let me tell you, the Abhyanga left me feeling incredibly rejuvenated. Apparently, the pressure points are strategically targeted. The clinic itself was quite impressive, a sprawling 1500 sq ft haven of tranquility amidst the Delhi chaos.

The clinic itself was quite impressive, a sprawling one thousand five hundred square feet haven of tranquility amidst the Delhi chaos.

unnormalised: I also started incorporating Ayurvedic principles into my daily life. Think early mornings, mindful eating, and focusing on consuming fresh, seasonal foods. I’ve even tried some simple yoga asanas and pranayama exercises.
normalised: I also started incorporating Ayurvedic principles into my daily life. Think early mornings, mindful eating, and focusing on consuming fresh, seasonal foods. I’ve even tried some simple yoga asanas and pranayama exercises.

unnormalised: It’s been about 2 months now, and the difference is remarkable! My skin is glowing, I’m sleeping like a baby, and my digestion is back on track. Plus, I feel calmer and more centered overall. The initial investment of about Rs. 5000 for the consultation and first few sessions was totally worth it.

Plus, I feel calmer and more centered overall. The initial investment of about rupees five thousand for the consultation and first few sessions was totally worth it.

unnormalised: Of course, Ayurveda is a journey, not a quick fix. I'm still learning and experimenting. But so far, it’s been an incredibly enriching experience. I encourage everyone to explore Ayurveda and see how it can benefit their lives. Maybe even visit an Ayurvedic retreat in Kerala sometime!
